item.title: 菲律宾在顶级电子钱包故障后加强金融科技监管
item.description: 一位官员表示，菲律宾央行正在寻求加强对金融科技平台的监管，因为它正在调查该国顶级移动钱包注册账户中未经授权的扣款行为。【原文：The Philippine central bank is looking to strengthen its supervision of fintech platforms, an official said, as it probes unauthorized deductions in accounts registered with the nation’s top mobile wallet.】

item.title: 布里奇沃特称特朗普可能会挑选更宽松的美联储主席
item.description: 桥水联合投资公司（Bridgewater Associates）联席首席投资官鲍勃-普林斯（Bob Prince）周三表示，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税、财政刺激和移民政策将可能推动美国无法实现2%的通胀目标。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump’s policies on tariffs, fiscal stimulation and immigration will likely push the US toward missing its 2% inflation target, Bridgewater Associates Co-Chief Investment Officer Bob Prince said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 利率决议前南非通胀率创四年新低
item.description: 南非的通货膨胀率降至四年多来的最低点，预示着周四借贷成本将再次降低。【原文：South Africa’s inflation rate declined to a more than four-year low, heralding another reduction in borrowing costs on Thursday.】

item.title: 制药商和消费者帮助丹麦经济延续反弹势头
item.description: 丹麦经济在第三季度扩大了涨幅，原因是制药商的产量继续增长，同时国内需求也开始回升。【原文：Denmark’s economy extended gains in the third quarter as drugmakers continued to grow their output while domestic demand also started to pick up.】

item.title: 印尼卢比承压，印尼央行维持关键利率不变
item.description: 印尼央行维持关键利率不变，继续暂停宽松政策，因为市场恐慌情绪和地缘政治紧张局势削弱了印尼盾的汇率，使其跌向1美元兑16,000印尼盾的关键支撑位。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank kept its key interest rate unchanged, extending a pause in its easing cycle as market jitters and geopolitical tensions weaken the rupiah toward the key support level of 16,000 per dollar.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行因汽车贷款调查在英国造成 2.95 亿英镑的影响
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）正在预留 2.95 亿英镑（3.75 亿美元），以应对其英国分部在汽车贷款调查中可能面临的法律费用和付款。【原文：Banco Santander SA is setting aside £295 million ($375 million) to cushion against potential legal costs and payments its UK unit faces in a car loans probe.】

item.title: 中芯国际击败英伟达 120% 股价涨幅面临芯片战威胁
item.description: 在过去两个月里，中芯国际半导体制造有限公司的股价上涨了一倍多，原因是预计中国将推动自力更生，即使存在与竞争和地缘政治紧张局势相关的风险。【原文：Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp.’s stock has more than doubled over the past two months on an expected boost from China’s self-reliance push, even amid risks tied to competition and geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 英国通胀率因能源原因超预期升至 2.3
item.description: 英国通胀加速超过预期，远高于 2% 的目标，这一增长使英国央行官员继续按计划 "逐步 "削减利率。【原文：UK inflation accelerated more than forecast to well above the 2% target, a pickup that keeps Bank of England officials on track for “gradual” interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 石场承诺通过税收谈判为刺激经济开绿灯
item.description: 日本民主党高级官员滨口诚（Makoto Hamaguchi）称，日本首相石破茂就其经济刺激计划与一个主要反对党达成了协议，承诺将反对党的减税提案纳入讨论范围。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba struck a deal with a key opposition party over his economic stimulus package, by promising that discussion of the opposition’s tax cut proposals will be included among the measures, according to Makoto Hamaguchi, a senior official in Japan’s Democratic Party for the People.】

item.title: 泰国经济将因特朗普关税计划遭受 46 亿美元打击
item.description: 一项研究显示，如果美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普兑现提高美国进口关税的承诺，泰国明年的经济增长目标有可能无法实现，因为这可能会损害这个东南亚国家的出口并削弱其货币。【原文：Thailand risks missing its growth target next year if President-elect Donald Trump follows through with his pledge to raise tariffs on imports into the US as it could hurt the Southeast Asian nation’s exports and weaken its currency, according to a study.】

item.title: 比特币 ETF 期权的推出是美国对加密货币的最新推动力
item.description: 贝莱德公司价值440亿美元的iShares比特币信托基金的首批期权下注表明，交易商认为比特币还有打破更多记录的空间。【原文：The first options wagers on BlackRock Inc.’s $44 billion iShares Bitcoin Trust suggest traders see scope for the token to break more records.】

埃及启动 2021 年以来首次 IPO，出售 1.1 亿美元银行股份
item.description: 埃及已开始出售联合银行多达 1.1 亿美元的股份，这是该国三年来首次公开发行股票，因为该国正在推进国际货币基金组织鼓励的私有化计划。【原文：Egypt has started selling a stake of as much as $110 million in United Bank, the country’s first initial public offering in three years as it presses ahead with a privatization program being encouraged by the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 瑞银联合高盛预测黄金涨势尚未结束
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）称，黄金将在明年年底前涨至每盎司 2,900 美元，这与高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Gold will rally to $2,900 an ounce by the end of next year, according to UBS Group AG, echoing a call from Goldman Sachs Group Inc. for further gains as central banks expand their holdings.】

item.title: 炼油厂加紧生产，俄罗斯燃料出货量跃升至 9 个月新高
item.description: 11 月上半月，俄罗斯精炼燃料出口反弹至 9 个月来的最高点，随着季节性检修的结束，精炼活动也随之增加。【原文：Russian refined fuel exports rebounded to a nine-month high in the first half of November, with a ramp-up in refining activity as seasonal maintenance winds down.】

item.title: 印度中央银行表示，印度正在扩大与更多国家的支付联系
item.description: 南亚国家中央银行的一位高级官员周三表示，印度正在与多个国家建立移动支付联系。【原文：India is forging mobile-payment linkages with several countries, a senior official at the South Asian nation’s central bank said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 香港地产大亨向反弹的 IPO 市场投入资金
item.description: 地产大亨们多年来首次为香港首次公开募股市场提供支持，此举可能有助于为刚刚开始的经济复苏煽风点火。【原文：Property tycoons are lending their support to the Hong Kong IPO market for the first time in years, a move that could help fan the flames of a nascent recovery.】

item.title: 日本企业对中国经济越来越悲观
item.description: 在华日资企业对中国这个世界第二大经济体的看法越来越悲观，约三分之二的企业认为中国经济正在恶化，近一半的企业缩减或停止了投资。【原文：Japanese firms in China are becoming more pessimistic about the world’s second-biggest economy, with about two-thirds saying it’s getting worse and almost half scaling back or halting their investments.】

item.title: 历史对美国未来的警示
item.description:
在本周的《投票经济学》（Voternomics）节目中，作者彼得-图尔钦（Peter Turchin）解释了为什么唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的回归并不令人意外，以及它所代表的意义。【原文：

On this week’s Voternomics, author Peter Turchin explains why Donald Trump’s return isn’t a surprise, and what it represents.

item.title: 保诚在中国市场的低迷为股价反弹埋下伏笔
item.description: 由于担心保险公司在中国的风险，保诚集团（Prudential Plc）的股价今年以来一路下跌，根据分析师的平均目标股价计算，保诚集团是富时 100 指数中隐含上涨空间最大的股票。【原文：Prudential Plc shares have fallen so far this year amid worries over the insurer’s China exposure that they now offer the most implied upside of any stock in the FTSE 100 index, based on average analyst price targets.】

item.title: 航空公司出走使以色列人及其公司孤立无援
item.description: 以色列对哈马斯的战争引发了对其作者的抵制，切断了与哈马斯科学家的合作，并可能对其官员发出逮捕令。但是，没有什么比来往以色列的航班大幅减少更让以色列人感到孤立无援了。【原文：Israel’s war against Hamas has sparked boycotts against its authors, cut cooperation with its scientists and raised possible arrest warrants against its officials. But nothing has made Israelis feel more isolated than the massive drop-off in flights to and from the country.】

item.title: 无人机制造商 Tekever 从 SpaceX 的支持者北约融资 7000 万欧元
item.description: 无人机制造商 Tekever 已获得 7000 万欧元（7400 万美元）融资，该公司表示将利用这笔资金拓展新市场，开发更大、更快的无人机系统。【原文：Drone maker Tekever has raised €70 million ($74 million) in funding, which the company says it will use to expand into new markets and develop bigger, faster unmanned aerial systems.】

item.title: 中国从美国进口液化天然气数量激增，下一场贸易战将对其构成威胁
item.description: 美国今年加大了对华液化天然气的销售力度，但如果即将上任的特朗普政府与中国政府在贸易问题上发生冲突，这种激增的势头可能不会持久。【原文：The US has boosted sales of liquefied natural gas to China this year, although the surge may not last if the incoming Trump administration collides with Beijing over trade.】

item.title: 欧洲央行和日本央行货币政策背离，欧元兑日元成为关注焦点
item.description: 欧元-日元正受到越来越多的关注，因为这两个地区的政策分歧似乎将为该货币对提供机会。【原文：Euro-yen is getting increased attention as policy divergence between the two regions looks set to offer opportunities in the currency pair.】

item.title: 橡树树的马克斯称 "无法投资 "的中国可提供物美价廉的资产
item.description: 橡树资本管理公司（Oaktree Capital Management LP）联席董事长兼联合创始人霍华德-马克斯（Howard Marks）表示，即使其他投资者避开中国这个世界第二大经济体，橡树资本管理公司仍在中国寻找便宜货。【原文：Oaktree Capital Management LP is looking for bargains in China even as other investors shun the world’s second-biggest economy, according to co-chairman and co-founder Howard Marks.】

item.title: 英伟达合作伙伴鸿海在人工智能热潮中获得 11 亿美元银行贷款

item.title: 阿联酋 1 万亿美元的市场主要由王室主导
item.description: 自大流行病爆发以来，阿拉伯联合酋长国上市股票的市值一路飙升，突破了 1 万亿美元。然而，在大幅攀升的背后，投资者面对的是一个由统治者严重主导的复杂市场。【原文：A surge in the years since the pandemic has propelled stocks listed in the United Arab Emirates past $1 trillion in market value. Yet behind the dramatic ascent, investors face a complex market heavily dominated by its rulers.】

item.title: 企业动荡照亮东京证券交易所，股市下跌一天
item.description: 周三，交易商和激进投资者为日本股市注入了新的活力，引发 Seven & i Holdings Co.、东京燃气公司（Tokyo Gas Co.）和小林制药株式会社（Kobayashi Pharmaceutical Co.【原文：Deal makers and activist investors injected drama into the Japanese equity market on Wednesday, triggering sharp rallies in shares of Seven & i Holdings Co., Tokyo Gas Co. and Kobayashi Pharmaceutical Co.】
